column4: The kernel has limited the per-uid mqueue space usage to 819200 bytes, but in Ubuntu there is no such limit, any idea?
That's prolly a ulimit setting, no?
Do you have time to talk about this with me?
In include/linux/mqueue.h, the limit is set to 819200 bytes.  But you always get all -1 (which means infinity) by calling getrlimit()
